crypto.name: delicious cooking
totally random art
crypto.desc:
VuwCTF suspects that this random art generator used to decorate top-secret documents was being used to leak sensitive information. Can you find the original flag?

The body of the flag contains only [a-zA-Z0-9_]

Author: maxster

forensic.name: 1.5x engineer 1
forensic.desc:
I had a dream where there were no standards for securely sending data over networks! Terrifying. Anyway one of my colleagues wanted to show off their new project and hid a flag!

This is the same packet capture as 1.5x-engineer 2

Author: ssourced

forensic.name: 1.5x engineer 2
forensic.desc:
That '10x engineer' apparently had no idea what they were coding. My PC got hacked during that demo! I was working on an important project proposal that they deleted, can you try to get it back?

This is the same packet capture as 1.5x-engineer 1

Author: ssourced

forensic.name: Matroiska
forensic.desc:
I found this strange PNG image called matroiska1.png. It looks innocent enough, but I have a feeling there's more to it than meets the eye. Can you help me find what's hidden inside?

Author: Aterlone

forensic.name: undercut
forensic.desc:
I love AI so much! This USB was dropped in a vent outside with the label 'LLMs only' on it. Can you make sure it doesn't have any hidden messages?

Author: ssourced

misc.name: bleep bloop
misc.desc:
AI communication has become totally invisible - how's that possible? They've transcended beyond the visible spectrum X Information has been gathered and transmitted below our microphones. 90.833 MHz

Hint: Thanks for calling Leonardo Hotel. How can I help you today?

Author: ssourced

misc.name: not turing complete
misc.desc:
VuwCTF is proud to announce the release of our new platform-as-a-service product, the Not Turing-Complete Interpreter! To celebrate this achievement, we are launching a programming competition using our new infrastructure.

Author: maxster

osint.name: Its News
osint.desc:
I took this photo of a newspaper clipping on campus. Can you help me ID it, and tell me which group keeps it safe?

Hint: I took this photo of a newspaper clipping on campus on my iPhone. Can you help me ID it, and tell me which group keeps it safe?

Hint 2: This challenge is as easy as 一, 二, 三

Flag format is VuwCTF{dd_mm_yyyy_originalpublicationname_currentcustodialorg} and is case insensitive

Author: Aterlone

osint.name: computneter
osint.desc:
i found this in e-waste what is it

Flag format is VuwCTF{Manufacturer_Model} and is case insensitive.

Author: TEDEOTU & ssourced

osint.name: rogue
osint.desc:
Our backend dev's gone rogue and started selling a bunch of our flags! I tried to trick him, but he's too good. I know he's doing it though!

This flag is case sensitive.

Author: ssourced

osint.name: whats a transistor
osint.desc:
This NZ building once housed a technological marvel! 5120 bytes of memory, 125 punch cards per minute... why would you ever need more? Can you find the organisation who purchased it (as an acronym), its clock rate (in kHz), and the mnemonic for the (simplest) rotate right instruction in its architecture?

Flag format is VuwCTF{OrG_23_JNZ} and is case sensitive.

Author: ssourced

pwn.name: blazingly fast memory unsafe
pwn.desc:
Is this modern, blazingly fast, memory-unsafe JIT-compiled language the future of programming?

++++++++++[>+++++++>++++++++++>+++>+<<<<-]>++.>+.+++++++..+++.>++.<<+++++++++++++++.>.+++.------.--------.>+.>.

Note: this code was implemented using the chasm library, but its implementation details are not necessary to solve this challenge.

Author: maxster

pwn.name: fruit ninja
pwn.desc:
Welcome to Fruit Ninja! Slice fruits to earn points and become the ultimate fruit ninja master!

Can you exploit the heap to achieve victory?

Author: Aterlone

pwn.name: idempotence
pwn.desc:
This program lets you load the flag into memory!

Author: maxster

pwn.name: kiwiphone
pwn.desc:
VuwCTF have created a new software to help keep track of international phone numbers! Surely this won't get us hacked... right?

Note: the dynamic linker and libc files used by the server have been provided for this challenge. To test the program, make sure those two files, as well as a flag.txt file are available in the same directory.

Author: maxster

pwn.name: tokaido
pwn.desc:
A very epic quest

Author: maxster

rev.name: Classy People Dont Debug
rev.desc:
Classy people never debug. Debugging is for people who aren't skilled enough to analyse binaries statically. It is not a useful skill to have.

"I'm going to dynamically analyse this anyway" - famous last words.

Just for clarification, static analysis is the intended way to solve the challenge.

Author: Aterlone

rev.name: a new machine
rev.desc:
I tried to find the flag in this program but it just said "exec format error" when I tried to run it. Please help me find the flag!

Author: leastinformednerd

rev.name: math solver
rev.desc:
Cybersecurity analysts have obtained a secret program from a data breach which appears to contain an encrypted flag. However, it appears that the VuwCTF board isn't very good at programming.

Author: maxster

rev.name: missing function
rev.desc:
I'm trying to find out how this program verifies the flag but I can't find the function it's calling anywhere!

Author: leastinformednerd

rev.name: ngawari vm
rev.desc:
Grammar? What's that?

Wait, is this even a VM?

Author: maxster

rev.name: string inspector
rev.desc:
What the syscall is going on?

Author: maxster

web.name: Go Go Cyber Ranger
web.desc:
You can do it Cyber Ranger!

Author: Aterlone

web.name: hangdle
web.desc:
i made a new game! set a word then show it to your friends!

Author: ssourced
